cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 300 mi ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then slowing and turning north-northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast, aiming for southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Ocean Springs MS to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS; Storm Surge Warning Port Fourchon LA to the MS/AL border including Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas, and Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from Port Fourchon LA eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) possible late Monday night into Tuesday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft inundation possible along the Plaquemines Parish coastline and lower Mississippi River outlets.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches, producing significant flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and the potential for isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands.
